intro: Schizoglossum connatum, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom during the summer months. Schizoglossum connatum is adapted to drought conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers.
